title: Saxony wide square sans with rounded corners
content:
hi there, can anyone help me identify the font used here. i got a pretty close match with “Aggie” from URW++ but the “y” is very different. can anyone match this more accurately? - - - Kath

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [saxonytype.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808135221/http:/typophile.com/files/saxonytype.jpg) | 34.6 KB |

 [‹ (x) Heat magazine typeface - TF Forever {Marc O}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808135221/http:/typophile.com/node/19667 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Ferrell International logo - ITC Serif Gothic {Yves, Patrick Broderick} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808135221/http:/typophile.com/node/19678 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kath harding

comments.content: [Metro Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808135221/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/victory/metro-gothic/) is close but the “a” is different
thanks manlio, yes i agree metro gothic is very similar however it is very heavy and of course as you’ve pointed out the “a” is very different. thanks for the suggestion. - K
This one is hard to ID since there are billions of techno/sci-fi fonts (especially free fonts) out there. These are relatively easy to create and if this was a logo it was probably custom.
